page.title: 03ROYSTON MUSEUM
page.content: things about new shops and stables. They are about three times as small. The museum also has a{newspaper press} and{pictures of shops}showing things that are sold in the shops, like eggs and pipes, shops sold almost anything so they were very good to have about. The Royston Museum was formed about six years ago.It is set halfway up Kneesworth Street in an old school building, two storeys high.The school was built in the late 19th century. The curator of the museum has aquired a number of interesting items. Among these includes a printing press used for printing early copies of the Royston Crow,{postbox}and{posters. Upstairs there is a balcony which overlooks the first floor.On the walls surrounding the balcony are old posters advertising beer and meat from shops in Royston.In one of the rooms
